summary: ICP (Internet Computer) full-stack starter app with Motoko backend and React + Vite + Tailwind + shadcn/ui frontend, featuring a Valentine-themed interactive landing experience with cute heart animations and playful "Yes/No" interaction constraints.

existing_features.title: Motoko backend canister scaffold
existing_features.description: Backend canister implemented in Motoko (main.mo) with generated candid/TS bindings for frontend integration.

existing_features.title: React + Vite + Tailwind frontend scaffold
existing_features.description: Frontend application scaffolded with Vite/React, Tailwind CSS, and project configuration (tsconfig, vite config, tailwind config, index.html/css).

existing_features.title: shadcn/ui component library integrated
existing_features.description: shadcn/ui component set added to the frontend (accordion, dialog, form controls, navigation, etc.) with supporting utilities and configuration.

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication hooks
existing_features.description: Client-side hooks and wiring for Internet Identity authentication and actor creation (useInternetIdentity, useActor) with lint safeguards for provider configuration.

existing_features.title: Valentine-themed UI layout and celebration effects
existing_features.description: ValentineLayout and CelebrationHearts components plus generated themed image assets (heart illustration and pattern background) used by the UI.

existing_features.title: Build/deploy template for ICP project
existing_features.description: Build template assets and scripts (Dockerfile, deploy.sh, icp.yaml, canister.yaml, workspace configs) for reproducible build and deployment.

existing_features.title: Local storage utility client
existing_features.description: Frontend storage utility (StorageClient) for persisting client-side state/settings.

existing_features.title: Playful “Yes/No” interaction with evasive “No” button
existing_features.description: Valentine landing interaction where selecting “No” is prevented via a playful cursor-evading/dodging behavior (rather than disabling the button), while “Yes” remains clickable and triggers celebratory effects.

existing_features.title: Customized landing question text
existing_features.description: Landing page question text updated to: "Yash will you be my valentine?".

existing_features.title: Post-Yes reveal sequence with inline videos
existing_features.description: After clicking “Yes”, the UI reveals and auto-plays two inline user-provided videos as part of the post-Yes sequence.

existing_features.title: Teddy-with-rose-bouquet static asset added
existing_features.description: Added a teddy-with-rose-bouquet JPEG asset to the frontend public assets for optional use in the landing page UI.

existing_features.title: Updated subtext below landing page question prompt
existing_features.description: Landing page text shown below the main question prompt was replaced/updated per request.

existing_features.title: Updated landing page choice button labels
existing_features.description: Landing page choice text updated: "yes, I'd love to!" → "Haanji obviously" and "not yet..." → "Nahi yaar".

existing_features.title: Yes/No options aligned on initial page load
existing_features.description: Adjusted the landing page layout so the “Yes” and “No” options render aligned on initial page load (before any interaction/animation occurs).

existing_features.title: Updated landing page text to “I LOVE YOU SONPARI”
synonyms: I LOVE YOU SONPARI copy update
existing_features.description: Replaced the relevant landing page text per request with: "I LOVE YOU SONPARI".

existing_features.title: Heart animations gated until after “Yes” click
existing_features.description: Updated the landing experience so heart/celebration animations do not run in the pre-Yes state; animations begin only after the user clicks “Yes”.

existing_features.title: “Yes” button remains fixed while only “No” button dodges
existing_features.description: Updated the landing interaction logic so the “Yes” button position remains stable and is not affected by any dodge/animation code; only the “No” button performs evasive movement.

existing_features.title: Smooth transition animation for evasive “No” button movement
existing_features.description: Added a small transition/animation so the “No” button’s evasive repositioning feels smoother rather than jumping abruptly.

existing_features.title: Update the evasive “No” button behavior so it only moves within the limited area around the Yes/No buttons (not the full card or screen).
Change the evasive trigger so the “No” button moves only when the cursor approaches it (proximity-based), rather than moving immediately on hover/enter.
Remove the sudden/bouncy movement and make the “No” button slide away smoothly to its new safe position; also ensure it never gets hidden under/behind the “Yes” button during or after movement.

new_feature_requests.summary: Refine “No” button evasive behavior: remove sudden bounce, make movement playfully roam, and ensure it never gets hidden under/behind the “Yes” button.

architectural_notes: Frontend uses React + Vite + Tailwind + shadcn/ui for UI composition and styling.
Authentication is handled via Internet Identity on the client, with an actor hook to call the Motoko backend canister.
Candid/TypeScript declaration files are generated for backend canister integration.
Repository includes an ICP-oriented build/deploy template (Docker, deploy script, canister yamls, workspace configs).
Interaction design decision: the “No” button should playfully dodge the cursor (not be disabled).
Post-Yes reveal sequence should display two user-provided videos inline on the page and auto-play immediately after the “Yes” click (sources: two Gmail attachment URLs provided by user).
User provided a teddy-with-rose-bouquet image asset as a base64-encoded JPEG data URI to use in the landing page UI (for AR-2).
Teddy-with-rose-bouquet image asset is stored at frontend/public/assets/teddy-with-rose-bouquet.jpg (available for UI use).
Revert applied: teddy bear element is not rendered in the landing page UI; only the asset remains available.
Interaction/animation change: no heart animations should run before the user clicks “Yes” (pre-Yes state should be static; celebration can start post-Yes).
known_issues: Provided video sources are Gmail attachment URLs, which may require authentication and may not be directly embeddable/streamable by the public frontend.

generatedImages.description: Generated Valentine heart illustration asset for UI.
Generated Valentine pattern background asset for UI.

projectName: Refine evasive “No” button behavior: proximity-triggered smooth slide within button area
